Description: The seven sorrows of the Virgin; Mary standing at the centre, slightly turned to the right, her arms crossed on her chest which is being pierced by a sword. Around her depictions of the seven sorrows, framed by circular clouds. These are, on the left from bottom to top: the Presentation in the Temple, the Flight into Egypt; Christ amongst the Doctors. Above the Virgin: the Road to Calvary. On the right from top to bottom: the Crucifixion, the Descent from the Cross and the Entombment. Late impression with several stains. Woodcut
Curator's comments: See 1909,0612.26 for a related design, described as a copy in Hollstein.
Bibliographic references: Pauli 1901-11 / Hans Sebald Beham: Ein Kritisches Verzeichniss seiner Kupferstiche Radirungen und Holzschnitte (888) (Beta)
Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (888) (Beta)
Associated names: Representation of: St John the Evangelist
Representation of: St Simon of Cyrene
Representation of: St Joseph of Arimathaea
